Client¶

Game¶

class client.Game(socket)¶

MOOD client cmd line

do_addmon(args)¶

Adds a monster to the field with the specified name, greeting, hitpoints, and coordinates.

Parameters:

  • monster_name – (str) The name of the monster. Must be one of the allowed monsters in the list ‘allow_monsters’.

  • hello – (str) The greeting string that the monster outputs.

  • hp – (int) The hitpoints of the monster.

  • coords – (tuple) The coordinates of the monster on the field in the format (x, y).

Returns:

None

do_attack(args)¶

Attacks the specified monster with the standard attack, which inflicts 10 points of damage.

Parameters:

  • name – (str) The name of the monster. Must be one of the allowed monsters in the list ‘allow_monsters’.

  • weapon – (str) The weapon to use for the attack.

Returns:

None

do_down(args)¶

Moves the player down 1 cell.

Returns:

None

do_exit(args)¶

Stop cmd line.

Returns:

None

do_left(args)¶

Moves the player left 1 cell.

Returns:

None

do_quit(args)¶

Disconnect from the server.

return:

None

do_right(args)¶

Moves the player right 1 cell.

Returns:

None

do_sayall(args)¶

Sends a message to all players.

Parameters:

message – (str) The text of the message to send.

Returns:

None

do_up(args)¶

Moves the player up 1 cell.

Returns:

None

Server¶

Client¶

class server.Client(name: str, addr: str)¶

A client object, representing a player in a multiplayer game. Each client has a name, address, hero object, and writer object for sending messages to other clients.

Attributes:

client_list: (dict) A class-level dictionary mapping client names to client objects.

broadcast(msg: str) → None¶

Sends a message to all clients in the client list except for the calling client.

param self:

(Client) The client sending the message.

param msg:

(str) The message to be sent to other clients.

return:

None

static connect(name: str, addr: str) → bool¶

Static method that creates a new client and adds it to the client list with the given name and address.

param name:

(str) The name of the client to be added.

param addr:

(str) The address of the client to be added.

return:

(bool) True if the client was successfully added to the client list, False otherwise.

static disconnect(name: str) → None¶

Static method that removes the client with the given name from the client list.

param name:

(str) The name of the client to be removed.

return:

None

static meta(name: str)¶

Static method that retrieves the client with the given name from the client list.

param name:

(str) The name of the client to be retrieved.

return:

(Client or None) The client object with the given name if it exists in the client list, or None otherwise.

Hero¶

class server.Hero¶

A hero object, representing the player’s character in a multiplayer game.

Attributes:

WEAPONS: (dict) A class-level dictionary mapping weapon names to damage values.

Monster¶

class server.Monster(name: str, hello_string: str, hp: int, coords: list[int])¶

A monster object, representing an enemy character in a multiplayer game.

Attributes:

monsters: (list) - list of monsters.

monsters = []¶

Game¶

class server.Game(player: Client | None)¶

Game class for MOOD.

Attributes:

ways (dict): dictionary of possible directions field (list): game field

add_monster(monster: Monster | None) → str¶

Adds monster to the game field

Parameters:

monster – (Monster) monster instance

Returns:

(str) message regarding monster addition

attack(pos: tuple[int], name: str, dmg: int) → tuple[str]¶

Carries out an attack on a monster at a specific location

Parameters:

  • pos – (int, int) monster coordinates in the field

  • name – (str) monster name

  • dmg – (int) damage to be inflicted

Returns:

(str, bool) message regarding the attack and boolean flag indicating whether the attack was carried out or not

change_hero_pos(way: str) → str¶

Changes hero’s position on the field

Parameters:

way – (str) direction of movement

Returns:

(str) message regarding hero’s movement and possible encounter with monster

encounter(x: int, y: int) → tuple[str]¶

Checks if there is a monster at a specific location and returns monster message and name

Parameters:

  • x – (int) x-coordinate

  • y – (int) y-coordinate

Returns:

(str, str) monster message and name
